Exodusx1414 - you ever thought maybe, you are being a victim to trolls intentionally feeding? At least part of the time ? I am guilty of calling people out, and I have been reported. More than once I was on a whole team that was set on trolling. 

I have learned to try and say "Hey can you try not to do ___ anymore? Do this instead" "can you play safer or hug the turret?" "You can try this" "If you are losing lane just ask for help" "dont go out alone" ETC. Their reply usually helps me at least know what I'm dealing with.

I get annoyed people think typing a lot is flaming. People are lazy and its a VERY casual environment. What irks me is 'If what I am saying is obvious, you are trolling/feeding/throwing or if what I am saying is NOT obvious then you should learn from it and not have a fit I'm typing it?

I try to suggest something and give feedback. Playing with a friend from work, that is truly not experienced has opened my eyes at how much skill/knowledge I have acquired over years of MOBA playing. There is no manual, MOBA for dummies. And what is out there can be helpful but is a lot to digest. 

If you played with him, you would think it was intentional. I just hope this new system does not punish noobs. True noobs.

It really doesn't help when all people say is "you're bad" and no knowledge is given to help improve the player. Thanks again ^_^

You're still not addressing the pre match screen which is where a lot of problems happen. Some players hold other players hostage by either demanding a position regardless of their pick order or going with a troll pick and threaten to afk/feed to force others to dodge if they don't get what they want. Since the LP cost of dodging is lower than a loss, often people do dodge and those toxic players get away with it free.

It's really hard to understand how you guys are putting all this effort into addressing toxic behavior when that loophole still exists and is just as much of a problem as in game toxic behavior. And nothing is being done about it.

Unfortunately, some of us have to stick it out and take the hit to our LP to report these types of players. I rarely (1 in maybe 100 games) dodge a game because of these types of players because I consider it the right thing to do to play it out and report them later for their behavior, but also because it prevents this person from possibly ruining the experience of the next group of people that they would have gotten into a lobby with anyways. I'll take the hit in LP to save 9 other people from having to deal with those people most of the time, and I know other some people do the same thing.

I do agree though; while Riot has access to the pre- and post-game chat logs, it's very frustrating to not be able to do something about the champ select trolls going "mid or feed smurfing" who will autolock the only champion they know how to play and ruin the experience for everyone else on the team. 

Unfortunately, there's not really a good system to put in place that couldn't be abused by players who just didn't like someone's pick. Any type of vote kick system could be easily abused, and having a report button in pre-game chat just ends up with players being angry before the game has even started. 

I think the only good option would be a "Leave Queue" button (with the traditional dodge penalties) that would give you a "Why did you leave the queue?" pop-up in the client to ask you why you left, with a dropdown box offering options such as "Did not have time to play", but most importantly a "Player Toxicity" option that would bring up the names of the other 4 players in your lobby and allow you to select and report that player(s) for their pre-game chat behavior. While this can obviously still be abused like any other system, it would at least allow for this behavior to be reported when you dodged a game instead of having to suffer through a 10-20 LP loss just to report the toxic player in question.

I think that suggestion is a pretty good solution actually. If I have to dodge a ranked game because of a troll it would be great to at least to do it without restarting league and being able to submit a report as to why I'm doing it and report a player for being toxic an champ select. It's not any more prone to abuse than the after game report tool.

Something like that is what I had in mind, I don't think allowing a team to get a free dodge or kick out a player would ever work, people would abuse that. But if you're already dodging and taking the LP loss, and you're doing it because someone is trolling and you don't want to go through a whole game with that behavior, you should be able to report them. And if they force enough people to dodge with that behavior, they should be banned. The whole community would be better off. That seems really obvious to me.

Maybe not banned right off the bat, but a ranked restriction for this type of behavior would seem incredibly appropriate, and then a ban if this behavior continued in their normal draft games while they were ranked restricted.

Hey dude,

We're trying to nail a lot of this stuff down with a new champ select (Teambuilder Draft). Every design decision the team's making with it is intended to get the friction in champ select down and just end any incentive to act a fool in champ select. One way we're tackling it is that when you queue up, you select two positions you want to play, and you're guaranteed to get one of them. Lyte talks about it here and there on Ask.FM. If you've got questions about how to solve pre-game griefing, that's a great option. 

http://ask.fm/RiotLyte

First off, I remember playing a ranked game with you once, and you were definitely one of the most positive players I ever played with. (I was top Jayce and you were Janna, I think)

That being said though, I was wondering why league doesn't have a "carrot" system. I don't know what Riot's response was on this question, but I've seen it asked before. What's your opinion on something like Dawngate's Karma system, where players could vote on who contributed positively to a game, and that affects the endgame rewards, which in this case, would be IP gain?

I liked the honor initiative when it first came out, but I felt like the rewards were only really aesthetic. Then they changed it, and people with honor ribbons were almost nonexistent. I felt like the honor system, overall, has failed in terms of fighting toxicity.

Perhaps this may have been because Dawngate was small, but I never saw toxicity in 95% of my games, mainly because the rewards at the end were partially determined by your fellow teammates and opponents.

Hey dude! Uh, Thanks! I hope we won >.>

We don't do an amazing job right now with rewarding positive play, though I think this icon is a good step. We do want to revisit Honor, but there's not timeline on it at the moment. The team's suuuuuper focused on Instant Feedback and champion select right now.

The Karma system sounds pretty cool, but I don't know a ton about it. I'll do some homework there, and thanks for the tip. RIP Dawngate.

One problem that keeps me away from ranked queue is the actual pick order. Picture this scenario(which happens to me EVERYTIME I go for a ranked game, solo or duo): I call a role and a champion that I want to play and I'm last pick, which shouldn't be too hard to get what I want, right? WRONG! Someone who's basically first pick as well as a solo player not only doesn't say which role he's going to play, but also refuses to either listen, say anything or generally admit to not being entitled for his personnal preference pick because he has priority over me in the draft. Last game I played ranked, this very scenario happened to me again, there was a draven(forgot his summoner name), he's not only insta lock, but he hasn't said anything before having his pick and he's not answering any of the other 4 people asking him why he did what he did when we were all talking about how to build our team comp. Once in game, he went bot lane with sona support and me as mordekaiser and he was cs'ing over me and taking whatever he pleased because he had an adc champion but never actually calling the role.

I hope that this "Teambuilder Draft" thing will take care of that kind of issue. It's really upsetting to have someone greed you out of a role because he gets to pick before you while not having to say anything. This kind of greed is offputting in either draft queues, normals and ranked alike.

The idea with team builder is that you pick the role you want and get the role you want. One of the things we all have to embrace in ranked (beside the trolls and Insta-locks, those are inevitable) is that we get better through game knowledge. Whenever I go into ranked and I get my position, I consider that a privilege instead of a right. So in those times where I'm last pick and I get the position that I might not prefer (not cause of trolls), I would always take it as a learning opportunity instead of "oh god ff at 20 i cant carry". We all wish that every gamer were kind and reasonable with their picks, but that won't happen. Attitude is a BIG part in what separates low elo players from mid to high elo players, apart from skill, game knowledge etc. 

- Hope this helps :)

What would posting it do? We know he smack talks, it's part of his persona. The stupidity in the system lies in that he is banned for cursing someone out, but someone who's intentionally feeding to provoke people to verbally abuse them won't be banned. Riot has been trying to argue the point that cursing out your teammates and making people go on tilt may lose you some games, but you're going to lose 99% of games where someone on your team is actively trying to make you lose. 

Dunky has been actively advertising your game and he gets no mercy when it comes to bans for something as trivial as verbal abuse? Trash talk is a big part of online gaming. If you don't like what they're saying, mute them. In CoD or battlefield, they use voice comms instead of chats, so when someone screams at the top of their lungs, it doesn't LOOK LIKE THIS, you can actually hear it. If someone curses you out, you get their actual voice and emotion in it, it isn't just text on a screen. However, you aren't forced to listen to it just like you aren't forced to read what people type to you on league. The voice comms are a lot more damaging than text but both platforms allow you to MUTE THE PERSON. If someone is cursing at you or saying bad words, remember that the default of the chat is to c**sor and that you have to actively and knowingly disable that default setting. You know what you're getting into.

tl;dr: only you can stop you from going on tilt. use the mute button and grow thicker skin. rito unban dunkey and start policing intentional feeding in ranked instead of bad words in norms.

So he's Anakin Skywalker? I knew it..
Think about it this way though, you would know dunky was in game with you when you saw his name, and you should know to not take it seriously, this whole thing got blown way out of proportion.

This hasn't excused professional players in the past; why should it excuse someone who is popular on Youtube?

Also keep in mind that he's currently under 2 million subscribers and there are (as of the last infographic Riot posted) 32 million active players monthly, or roughly 1 in 16 players will even know who he is, and this 32 million number is old. This means that even taking his MMR or queue type into account, there's probably only one person per game he plays in (besides himself) that may even know who he is, and quite possibly none.

When 8 out of 10 players have no idea that he's being sarcastic or joking, that's the equivalent of you and a duo queue talking smack on everyone and abusing them, which is a common occurrence that results in chat restrictions and bans regularly.

Unacceptable behavior for everyone else should not be excused based on who you are.
